appearances.title: Время покажет : 1TV : January 13, 2026 6:30pm-7:46pm MSK
appearances.snippet: this was done by trump's fellow republican, senator randy fine. fine is a rather odious man; at one point, he called for the extermination of all the inhabitants of greenland. using a nuclear bomb, now he's even more convinced that without greenland, the united states cannot survive. greenland isn't a remote outpost we can ignore; it's a vital national security resource. whoever controls greenland controls key arctic shipping lanes and the security architecture that protects the united states. russia and china pose a real strategic threat to our country. that's why i support president trump in his desire to make greenland part of the united states. we need it to serve as a buffer between us and russia, we need it for natural resources. that's why i introduced the bill, and i hope congress will vote for it. it's fantastic. we live in amazing times, just maybe greenland, let's make greenland green again, green, yes, some other states of the united states, by the way, that's enough here, i think it's appropriate to remember that the united states onc

appearances.title: MS NOW Reports : MSNOW : January 1, 2026 10:00am-11:01am PST
appearances.snippet: i think it's especially important at a time when you have folks like tommy tuberville and randy fine in the republican party calling for the purge of all muslims in the country to have a figure like mamdani rise and have it be so joyful and celebrated in the greatest city in the world. and i think it also tells the story of what he'll definitely be able to succeed on, because i think the policy battles are going to be tough. but as a cultural figure and a leader of the city, a mascot of new york city, he's going to be amazing. and i think we saw a little bit of that with the storytelling of getting sworn in in the old city hall subway, so i'm sure we'll see a lot more of that. i know a lot of new yorkers feel heard and represented by him and his campaign, especially young people as well. >> i think right now we're hearing new york state of mind, billy joel playing over the loudspeaker there at the at the inauguration is it's going to be getting underway soon. reena mamdani made a lot of campaign promises, most of them around affordability. so at the end of the day, is his success ult

appearances.title: Inside Politics With Manu Raju : CNNW : January 11, 2026 5:00am-6:00am PST
appearances.snippet: but, joan, i want you to react to what we've heard from congressman wesley hunt of texas and randy fine of florida. >> the bottom line is this when a federal officer gives you instructions, you abide by them, and then you get to keep your life. >> if you get in the way of the government repelling a foreign invasion, you're going to end up just like that lady did yesterday. >> what do you think? >> it's grotesque and idiotic. look, i sabrina was saying, look, you protesters shouldn't get in the way of law enforcement action if this was irs agents, you know, in texas going after somebody and right wing protesters were getting in the way, there would be a lot of people on the left saying, how dare you get, you know, this insurrectionist and all that kind of thing. it's dumb on either side. at the same time, getting in the way of law enforcement is not a capital offense, punishable by summary execution, which is what these goofballs are saying. there's so much stupidity in all of this when people say, oh, so she should just be allowed to get away? well, maybe they have her license plate. th

appearances.title: Утро России : RUSSIA1 : January 14, 2026 5:00am-8:59am MSK
appearances.snippet: republican congressman randy fine introduced the bill the day before.exation and granting of us statehood to greenland. snowfalls and blizzards descended on northern japan due to a powerful atmospheric front. the second-largest island of hakaide was literally blanketed in snow, transforming the local landscape. due to a dense blanket of snow and hurricane-force winds, visibility on the roads was virtually zero. railroad companies were forced to suspend train service on some routes. severe flooding followed heavy rains and river overflow, with water levels rising in one area. more than a meter. the first floors of buildings now news from the capital region. heavy snowfall will return to moscow today. precipitation will continue until the evening. the air temperature will be -6°c, high atmospheric pressure, 752 mm hg, rising to 770 points, an abnormal value for the capital region, by the weekend . it will also get colder in some areas. temperatures in the region will drop to -20°c. escalators at several moscow metro stations have been closed for repairs.
